column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////For Tonkotsu Black Ramen
column2: this place has more of traditional thin straight noodle with broth that is creamy but not too oily (I know some people complain that this is oily but from standard in Japan this is not oily at all). However
column5: there is some mismatch with the topping. Topping of cachu is good
column6: but there is some imbalance compared to Tiger Den. So I still have to give Tiger Den the edge. So then what about Samurai Ramen
column8: but I think that there will be a split opinion
column9: it is more of a typical that you can get in Japan. So I like it
column10: but it lacks the uniqueness compared to Tiger Den or Jinya.
